choices.A: It can analyze performance over any given time period.
choices.C: It can analyze performance using data captured on all instances.
choices.B: It can diagnose skew in response time.
choices.D: It can only analyze performance on the instance running the ADDM job.
choices.F: It runs automatically in Instance ADDM mode after each AWR snapshot is created.
choices.E: It can diagnose latency problems in the Cluster Interconnect.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
BCE is correct.

Using ADDM with Oracle Real Application Clusters

The Database mode report includes findings about database resources (such as I/O and interconnect).
I would choose BCE , A... I am not sure what "any given time period" means....It is limited by captured data.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true concerning Automatic Database Diagnostic Monitor (ADDM) for RAC? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
Pluggable Databases (PDBs). TRUE. You can use srvctl relocate pdb -eval or srvctl relocate service -eval to see the potential impact of relocating a PDB or a service associated with a PDB. This helps you understand which instances will be affected and how the PDB and its services will be moved. You can also evaluate the impact on PDBs when activating a policy using crsctl activate serverpool <pool_name> -eval or srvctl activate serverpool -serverpool <pool_name> -eval
---
Local resources. FALSE. While local_resource is a type of cluster resource that can be created, the -eval option is intended for evaluating the impact of commands that affect cluster-managed resources and their dependencies. It won't provide specific insights into resources that are purely local to an operating system and not managed by Clusterware

Selected Answer: ACD
Sure of ACD

Selected Answer: ACD
Given answer ACD is correct

From documentation: 
"Oracle Clusterware 12c has the ability to react to events in the system and produce a response action plan. This action plan consists of a series of resource state transitions and/or server pool reconfigurations.
What-If response plans are available for the following event categories:
• Resources: start, stop, relocate, add, and modify
• Server Pools: add, remove, and modify
• Servers: add, remove and relocate
• Policies: change active policy
• Server Category: modify"

https://www.oracle.com/docs/tech/database/oracle-clusterware-12c-overview.pdf

questions.question_text: For which three entities can the "what-if" command evaluation be used to determine the impact of clusterware management operations in Oracle 19c Clusterware? (Choose three.)
Which two statements are true concerning the installation of Oracle Grid Infrastructure 19c Cluster? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Normal Redundancy ASM Disk Groups used for Clusterware files will contain three voting files regardless of the number of failgroups.
choices.D: The Clusterware binaries may be installed without installing ASM binaries.
choices.A: The Grid Infrastructure Management Repository is only required when using ASM.
choices.B: Specifying the use of Grid Naming Service is optional.
choices.E: High Redundancy ASM Disk Groups used for Clusterware files will contain two OCRs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
BD 100%. GNS is optional and clusterware che use shared nfs storage

Selected Answer: AD
A. an application VIP (Virtual IP):

Purpose: The application VIP provides a single, stable IP address that clients use to connect to the application, regardless of which node the application is currently running on.
High Availability Role: When a node fails, the VIP and the application resources associated with it are automatically failed over to another node in the cluster. Clients can continue to access the application using the same VIP, ensuring uninterrupted service.

D. an application resources:

Purpose: These are the components that Oracle Clusterware manages and monitors to ensure the application's availability. This could include the application's executables, configuration files, database instances, listener, etc.
High Availability Role: Oracle Clusterware monitors these resources. If a resource fails or a node fails, Clusterware will attempt to restart the resource or fail it over, along with the associated VIP, to another healthy node.

Selected Answer: CD
Script is not required. It can be set if needed

questions.question_text: Which two components must always be defined or specified by an administrator to make an application highly available using Oracle 92c Clusterware? (Choose two.)

choices.C: A database instance on a node cannot be a client of an ASM instance running on other nodes.
choices.A: ASM Cluster File System (ACFS) can be deployed on any nodes.
choices.F: An ASM instance and database instances can coexist on the same node.
choices.B: A database instance on a node can be a client of an ASM instance running on any node.
choices.D: A database instance on a node can only be a client of an ASM instance running on the same node.
choices.E: A database instance on a node uses an ASM instance as an I/O server when requesting I/O to diskgoups.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true regarding ASM on a four-node cluster? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BEF
A: ASM Cluster File System (ACFS) can be deployed on any nodes. False
Oracle ACFS file systems cannot be used for an Oracle base directory or an Oracle Grid Infrastructure home that contains the software for Oracle Clusterware, Oracle ASM, Oracle ACFS, and Oracle ADVM components. However, Oracle ACFS file systems can be configured for use as a home for applications.
E: A database instance on a node uses an ASM instance as an I/O server when requesting I/O to disk groups. True
When a database instance creates or opens an Oracle ASM file, it communicates those requests to the Oracle ASM instance. The ASM instance then provides file extent map information to the database instance. In the case where the database instance is on a node that does not have direct access to Oracle ASM disks, the database instance uses an Oracle IOServer (I/O Server) instance to access the storage.

Selected Answer: ABF
E is wrong
